pros: I have never before worked for a company that treated its employees with such inclusivity, respect, flexibility and generosity. Our staff are also the kindest and most professional people I have ever had the honor to work with.
cons: No opportunities for continued learning from an administrative perspective. On a positive note, there are options for the clinical staff who SHOULD have priority to furthering education in a hospice setting.

review_title: Selfish and arrogant management will abandon you
pros: You can learn things work in the real world and how you need to be clever to deal with difficult people.
cons: The management is selfish. I am sorry, but there is no other word for it. These cunning people with a poor attitude would abandon you when there is a compliment. They will not trust you, and you will have to deal with the stressful situation alone. Beware, and always be ready for that! Avoid trusting them.

pros: I am grateful to be part of a team that encourages continuous learning and supports us in delivering the best possible service to our patients. The experience has been truly rewarding, both professionally and personally. The clear delineation of tasks and responsibilities simplifies our work, allowing us to manage even heavy patient loads efficiently. This level of organization not only fosters productivity but also helps maintain the high quality of care we are committed to providing.
cons: The challenges we face push us to become more proficient in our roles and refine our clinical skills.

pros: I have the flexibility to work independently or seek assistance whenever necessary. Each day, I take on tasks that make a difference in the lives of the people in my care and I am left with a sense of fulfillment by the end of it.
cons: The standards for patient care are high and they have high expectations from their employees

pros: Good work and life balance
cons: Management will not have your back if there is a complaint

pros: I enjoy working with my passionate co-workers.
cons: The only problem with this company is its leadership. Most people in the management are problematic, and they clearly aren't as passionate as the employees. Our supervisors are extremely toxic and rude. They talk to us while yelling, which shows their lack of respect toward the employees and sometimes even the clients.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Janesville, WI
pros: Very supported by management, great teamwork, flexibility
cons: I don’t have any cons

review_title: Management is Very Clever and Evil
pros: When an extremely terrible management team dominates you, you won't even have the desire to look for any pros or positives.
cons: The management is awful. They spend a lot of time persuading you that they offer a decent work-life balance during the interview. Soon, you will realize that they lie blatantly and are actually evil. These fake people will never directly ask you to work exhausting and brutal hours, but they will create such an environment that you cannot avoid the additional hours. BEWARE!

review_title: Needs a thick face and a tough heart, but still, the job is brutal, stressful, and AWFUL!
job_title: Billings and Claims Specialist in Madison, WI
pros: The facilities were nice, the patients enjoyed it thereunto knowing what happens behind the desks!
cons: Dealing with collections and payment was brutal! You need a thick face and a tough heart, but still the job is excruciating and terrible! You get no support from the management, not even your closest supervisor really seem to care! Thinking of that only makes the situation more stressful, exhausting, and AWFUL!

pros: Agrace works hard to be inclusive and engaging.
cons: Very high workload. High staff turnover.

pros: Good pay, friendly staff, great co-workers
cons: Benefits I’ve heard aren’t the greatest but I did not use

job_title: RN Case Manager in Fitchburg, WI
pros: PTO accrual Patient care Coworkers
cons: Management Serious HIPPA violations not being addressed Lack of Communication Large Caseloads Low pay No Advancement Opportunities Teams are not run the same in all areas

job_title: Patient Experience Coordinator in Fitchburg, WI
pros: Genuinely care about patients, families, and staff. Wonderful people. Good work like balance.
cons: Staffing challenges. Quick growth means sometimes hard to keep up with changes.

review_title: Great place to learn and grow
pros: Was a great place to learn and grow to a certain point, but not entirely unexpected for an admin role with no clinical experience or expertise or a masters degree. Great people, fun work environment. This is a great position for someone with limited work experience or fresh out of college.
cons: Sometimes perfection was expected, vs trying to look at ways to minimize mistakes getting past a certain thresh hold or increased accountability for the work. Emotionally exhausting work, but offer great PTO to take breaks. However, they were always trying to get more out of an individual with specific knowledge or skills without increasing compensation appropriately or offering promotion.

pros: Hospice is a noble career path
cons: Nursing administration is focused on improving their careers not focused on patient care.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Madison, WI
pros: Wonderful co-workers, rewarding job helping patients at end-of-life and lovely facility.
cons: Management is not interested in employee satisfaction. They change job requirements without notice and employees are encouraged to report on one another for insignificant things. CNA's, RNs, and social workers are a high turn-over commodity.

pros: truly excellent patient care, always puts patients and families first, I would trust them with my loved one's care
cons: upper management have a huge disconnect to the rest of this organization's employees, they do not accurately see the bigger picture compared to those giving amazing patient care. It's more about money more than retaining excellent employees, great employees fired after 5-12+ years of committing to this organization. Great employees giving notice with no response from HR or upper management to encourage them to stay. Employees and floor staff (nurses, CNAs, RNCMs, SWs) voices are not heard or valued as they should be. Constant call-offs for nursing staff. upper management is not trustworthy and there are continual changes/turnover due to these issues.

review_title: Not perfect, but neither am I!
pros: Great culture, love the mission, lots of great leaders and love the work we do!
cons: Saying the organization loves meetings is a understatement!

pros:
Mission driven
Very patient focused
cons:
Toxic executive culture
High turnover

job_title: In Home Caregiver in Madison, WI
pros: flexible schedule, short or long shifts your choice, nice management and scheduling
cons: NO BENEFIT OPTIONS FOR AGE AT HOME(you CANNOT get insurance no matter how much your work.) The minimum work hours went from 10 to 15, now required to work one weekend per month concurrently, there can often not be shifts available in your area causing you to have to drive a good distance and time driving is not reimbursed, lastly if you do the shorter shifts you will sometimes need around 10 shifts for the week to meet 40 hrs.

job_title: Hospice RN Case Manager in Baraboo, WI
pros: Good management. Good team members.
cons: Long distances to drive to places

review_title: Great organization, difficult to maintain work/life balance
pros: Great coworkers, wonderful facilities, excellent volunteers.
cons: Salary is not competitive, there is often a lot of travel, Medical Directors were not very friendly, and charting often required working into the evenings.

review_title: Terrible, Unprofessional Management at ALL levels in ALL Deparments
pros: Fair compensation for the amount of work you do.
cons: Managers and "Favorite" employees create a toxic, bullying environment. If you're not a favorite, or a brown-noser, your days are numbered!!! Many excellent employees have been targeted and treated very unfairly by management and the HR dept. Most of these employees were hard-working loyal employees. Management and HR has a "Lets throw some mud at a wall and see what will stick" approach. They tend to listen to gossip, hear-say and drama queens. If you have any integrity, prefer to be treated fairly, want to be respected for what you know and what you bring to the organization instead of who you know and whose butt you're kissing, Agrace IS NOT the place for you; You'll be very unhappy both personally and professionally. Agrace truly needs to clean house with Management and HR Department!!

pros: Wonderful direct care co-workers who are dedicated to the job and serving the patients and their families.
cons: The Senior Leadership is removed from the work and lacks an understanding of the day to day operations on the units. They make decisions based on money and not on patient care and as a result their decisions often lead to the exodus of excellent clinical staff (including docs and NPs, RNs and SWs).

pros: Inclusion from day one. Very focused on orientation and training, more than anywhere I've ever worked.
cons: Coming from a non-medical background, there has been a learning curve.

pros: They have a very good pay rate
cons: All over the place hours

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Fitchburg, WI
pros: Positive employees, nurses, top notch care
cons: Rude upper management; poor benefits

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Madison, WI
pros: Work with some great people.
cons: Too heavy of a workload.

job_title: Registered Nurse Case Manager in Madison, WI
pros: This place truly cares about its employees and moves mountains to make sure they have everything necessary to provide great patient care. The pay is highly competitive. Senior leadership listens and acts on employee input. I love my co-workers.
cons: Have been here for 5 years and I don't have a single complaint! How lucky is that?!

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Madison, WI
pros: Good at work life balance, manager does not micromanage, employee engagement
cons: Will stay very busy throughout the day

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Madison, WI
pros: Compassionate and supportive management, organized and flexible scheduling, very good pay, tuition reimbursement, job advancement opportunities, adequate staffing (most of the time), nurses are amazing, nice facility, diversity among staff
cons: None besides last minute call offs sometimes

pros: Still a small town feel with resources that are common in corporations
cons: Still trying to act like a small town hospice while being the size of a large hospice

pros: Work with disabled/elderly providing all kinds of care/services
cons: No help with gas and one can drive as much as 200 miles or more week

job_title: Hospice RN Case Manager in Madison, WI
pros:
Really support staff
Compassionate caring team
cons: Long hours but very rewarding

review_title: It's like heaven on earth!  It truly is very rewarding to work in this environment?
pros: Agrace does so many things for the community.  Agrace also goes above & beyond families expectations during their loved ones end of life & no request is too big or small.  99% of the employees have that helping hand & friendly personality that you truly feel like the kindness & care that you're surrounded by is so surreal. Pets are welcome - a horse has even been in the facility.  Beds have been moved to allow families to sleep in the same room or even next to the patients. Want a milkshake at 2 am? No problem. A spa bath? Again, no problem.
cons: As all careers in the medical field can sometimes be overwhelming to complete in a timely manner, coworkers are very willing to assist when needed as long as they're not in the middle of something. With that being said,  there's times you'll get a group of patients that all need close 1:1 care, are risk for falls, or are always on their call light, so you'll sometimes notice you have no time to chart until the end of your shift. You'll feel fatigued at times or have minimal chances to get to the restroom,  but since you're a medical professional (whether CNA, LPN, RN's etc.) you're already aware that this is common no matter the facility of employment.

pros:
Salary is competitive 
PTO is generous
cons:
On-call pay varies drastically by discipline
Management will fire you to make an example

pros: Staff giving direct care to patients are excellent-- competent and compassionate (though turnover of these is high due to frustration with leadership); team approach (though teams are re-formed too often, lending to instability)
cons: Dysfunctional leadership, especially at senior level. Intimidation and lying are common. Major decisions are made without including key knowledgeable/experienced players. If you are a "yes-man," you will succeed here. If you are driven by integrity, you'll be frustrated or not last long. Image and bottom line trump patient and family care. Agrace really dropped the ball when they chose to eliminate chaplains from their care teams, opting instead for counselors who primarily offer grief support after death. The environment and team dynamics changed after that, and leaving spirituality out of hospice makes no sense. Agrace was extraordinary at one time. New leadership, bad decisions, high turnover, really stressed out employees (due to unreasonable expectations), and putting patient care second has brought Agrace down to being a rather ordinary hospice. Poor employee morale.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Madison, WI
pros:
Good pay
Work every 5th weekend
M-F job
Very rewarding job itself
cons:
You can work up to 80 hours per week
You never truly have a day off (even on your days off). 
They say that you aren't expected to work during your vacations but you are held accountable for anything that happens while you are on vacation.
Only listen to patients and do not support their employees.
Does not promote learning. You learn you did something incorrectly when you are written up for it.
Do not ask for help because you will start getting written up
Everything falls to the case mangers
Management is very two faced. 
Disappointed in this place as an employer.

review_title: Watch out for HR and executive leadership. There’s a dark side here.
pros: Patient clients and families, and some of the best co-workers at the entry and mid-levels of the company.
cons: Lip service to “supportive working environment” but watch out for HR and executive leadership. Agrace doesn’t like to pay benefits to employees who have been with the company 5+ years - so many examples of this in just the last few months alone. There’s a dark side here to what everyone agrees is the best hospice care available in Madison. Agrace is beloved  in the community because of hard-working nurses and  clinical staff  and deserves that reputation but  you won’t have the support of HR or executive leadership here. The diversity structure here includes white people at the top and poor female people of color at the bottom without living wages or healthcare.

review_title: They are focused on money first and foremost........................................
pros: Amazing direct co-workers. amazing gift to get to care for people at their most vulnerable times.
cons: Its not a safe place to work, they do not support their staff and people seemed to disappear regularly and we were never told why.

job_title: Quality Analyst/Process Improvement Engineer in Madison, WI
pros: Good mission, most people working there care deeply about the core of what hospice is about. Interested in improving things but not always sure how to go about it.
cons: Ultimately it often felt very easy to be blindsided by things. Many times I would think that things were going very well, only to have a major upheaval coming from a completely separate section of the company, often at the direction of someone with more unwritten "clout". Sometimes felt like your performance was being evaluated via appearance or "the grapevine" rather than actual results.

pros: The department I am in stresses healthy work/life balance.  Teaming is important across the organization.  The ability to work across disciplines to provide top-notch care is important to all.
cons: The work can be taxing as you are working in high-stress situations on a regular basis.  That is to be expected though as it is in almost all healthcare roles.

pros: Amazing, caring, professional people with real heart.
cons: Too many organization-wide changes with little to no follow-through.

pros: Great teamwork and support from leadership! Good pay, benefits and a great culture. I love working here. It feels like it's own community and has been voted a Best Places to Work agency several times.
cons: Emotionally difficult work but it is so rewarding. While the agency is wonderful there are times where there are a lot of changes and it can be difficult to know where to focus your efforts.

review_title: Inept management, unable to plan and deliver care with true focus on holistic well-being of patients, family, staff.
pros: Supporting patients and families through end-of-life experience in spite of incredibly uninformed and non-clinical management. Uneducated team leaders but excellent co-workers.
cons: Unreasonable working hours, detrimentally consumed with archaic medical model, no spiritual counsel available for staff, ridiculous management, nasty political atmosphere

pros: Overall mission and vision of the company is wonderful...most employee's care about the work they do and try to provide best care possible to those on hospice services.
cons: Company promotes work/life balance...however felt at times that I shouldn't take time off, needed to put in long hours, etc.

job_title: RN HOME CARE in Fitchburg, WI
pros: The patients are great. It is Meaningful work. The benefits are good. Coworkers generally are great and get along well.
cons: The management in the department where I worked was terrible. Problems with communication, fairness, changing rules depending on who was asking, very difficult to get time off, Job expectations changed without any direct discussion, Micromanagement, and lack of respect for employees as individuals. No positive feedback given. Very quick to criticize.

pros: Clinical staff work very hard long hrs, dedicated to pts families. Hospice care is rewarding work with any agency
cons: Management will get rid of you if you value your time with family. They make you work long hrs. You can never plan time after work and miss out on family activities.

review_title: HR manager is not compassionate at all.
pros: Good benefits and good PTO. Wonderful coworkers, whom are helpful and caring.
cons: If you become seriously ill, the Manager of HR is very rude and has no compassion at all. They expected me to return to work too early with major life threatening illness.

pros: co-workers were wonderful to work with. We had to look out for one and other.
cons: Atmosphere was very stressful, after the New CEO Lynne Myers took over.

pros: Very strong mission. Staff are truly dedicated. Clinical leaders work hard to meet the needs of the patients and the staff.
cons: Balance between patient care and financials can be tough.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Madison, WI
pros: Many employee perks! Good benefits. Great mission.
cons: Everyone works hard and it can be draining.

pros: great job - do good work with a great support system
cons: management goals don't always align with staff goals

pros: Great opportunities to grow and learn. Friendly employees
cons: Could move a little more towards more flexible hours.

review_title: I would be cautious, especially with the Baraboo Office
job_title: RN Case Manager in Baraboo, WI
pros: My coworkers sincerely cared about patients and families.
cons: Impossible to see all of the patients I was assigned to see. I normally worked 15 plus hours per day, 6-7 days per week.

pros: Good life work balance and benefits
cons: Lack of communication with department leaders

pros: Wonderful co-workers, friendly management
cons: Limited hours at times
